title: Babylon's losses top £60m as virtual doctor app aggressively expands
text:
Losses have surged above £60m at a virtual doctor app praised by Health Secretary Matt Hancock as it expands aggressively overseas.

Babylon reported a £65m loss as it added hundreds of staff and launched its symptom-checking programme into new markets.

The London start-up - founded by Iranian-born entrepreneur Ali Parsa in 2013 - provides an automated online service where users describe symptoms and answer questions, as well as an internet appointment system called GP at Hand.

Revenues hit £9.6m at the company's UK operations last year, according to accounts for Babylon Partners and Babylon Health Services. The firms are ultimately owned by a Jersey-based company.

Babylon has won glowing praise...
description: Losses have surged above £60m at a virtual doctor app praised by Health Secretary Matt Hancock as it expands aggressively overseas.
